revised_title: Characterization of a TTX-Sensitive Sodium Current in Xenopus Oocytes
tldr: The authors studied a TTX-sensitive sodium current in native Xenopus oocytes and characterized its electrophysiological properties. The current was activated by depolarizations to -50 mV or higher, had a peak current within 3-5 ms, and displayed voltage-dependent inactivation. The sodium channel responsible for this current was blocked by tetrodotoxin with a K0.5 of 8 nM and was resistant to block by lidocaine at concentrations up to 100 µM.
